text: Charles Hillman Brough was an American Democratic Party politician. He was the governor of Arkansas from 1917 to 1921. During his time as governor, many reformsCharles Hillman Brough (1876–1935) Twenty-fifth Governor (1917–1921) were carried out such as the establishment of a State General Hospital "to provide free health care for qualified patients."Readings in Arkansas Politics and Government edited by Janine A. Parry, Richard P. Wang, David Pryor, P.174 ==References== Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Governors of Arkansas Category:1876 births Category:1935 deaths
title: Charles Hillman Brough
